body_html:
@sarah-zaheer It would be most straight forward if you built the pip builder:

bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

After that completes, you could either build a wheel archive to install with pip by doing

bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /some/directory/to/put/the/whl/in

or if you're interested in this specific generated file, it should be at

bazel-genfiles/tensorflow/python/ops/gen_audio_ops.py
body_text:
@sarah-zaheer It would be most straight forward if you built the pip builder:
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

After that completes, you could either build a wheel archive to install with pip by doing
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /some/directory/to/put/the/whl/in

or if you're interested in this specific generated file, it should be at

body:
@sarah-zaheer It would be most straight forward if you built the pip builder:
```
bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```

After that completes, you could either build a wheel archive to install with pip by doing
```
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /some/directory/to/put/the/whl/in
```
or if you're interested in this specific generated file, it should be at
```
bazel-genfiles/tensorflow/python/ops/gen_audio_ops.py
```
